text: Belvue is a city in Pottawatomie County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 177 people lived there. ==History== Belvue was planned out in 1871. The first post office in Belvue was created in May 1871. ==Geography== Belvue is at (39.216297, -96.179001). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==People== Belvue is part of the Manhattan, Kansas Metropolitan Statistical Area. ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 177 people, 61 households, and 46 families living in Belvue. Of the households, 73.8% owned their home and 26.2% rented their home. The median age was 31.6 years. Of the people, 85.3% were White, 0.6% were Asian, 2.3% were from some other race, and 11.9% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 11.9% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 205 people, 68 households, and 53 families living in Belvue. ===2000 census=== The 2000 census says that there were 228 people, 75 households, and 54 families living in Belvue. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * City of Belvue * Belvue - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 320 , local school district ;Maps * Belvue City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Pottawatomie County, Kansas
title: Belvue, Kansas
